column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper to Spiral, via Symplectic. However, the file provided has retained highlighted edits, corrections and review comments which we do not think would be suitable to be placed online. Do you have a cleaner version of this accepted manuscript available?

column1: If you do, please return to the record in your Symplectic profile, delete the file and upload a cleaner version of the file. Delaying this may result in your output being non-compliant, despite being deposited in Spiral. If you do not have an alternative version, and are happy for this version to be published in Spiral as-is, please confirm, and I will proceed to complete the deposit in Spiral.

column7: > Please note that conference abstracts are out of scope for REF and don't need to be deposited in institutional repositories. Therefore, if you do not wish to deposit your abstract, no action is required to this email.

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper. Unfortunately I was unable to find any information regarding the conference’s copyright policy on the organiser’s website. The College must ensure that it complies with conference organisers’ copyright policies before any papers can be uploaded to Spiral.

>Please can you verify whether you have permission to upload your paper? If you need to contact the publisher, please feel free to use our permissions request template, available at http://www.imperial.ac.uk/media/imperial-college/research-and-innovation/scholarly-communication/public/spiral-permissions-letter.docx
>If permission has been granted, please send evidence of this to openaccess@imperial.ac.uk. As soon as we have received your response we can proceed to upload your paper to Spiral.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting a link to your publication. In order for the open access team to check whether your output is compliant with the post REF 2021 Open Access Policy we need to determine that the version linked to in arXiv is the accepted version of this paper. As such, could you please supply a statement confirming this, as per below:

>I, the author of TITLE, DOI/CITATION, can confirm that the version of the paper currently held in arXiv:ARXIV NUMBER, version 1/2/3/4 etc., is the accepted manuscript version of this paper, which was submitted to arXiv on INSERT ARXIV DEPOSIT DATE, prior to its first publication on PUBLICATION DATE.

>We require this statement to be able to demonstrate your paper’s compliance with the REF open access policy. Once this statement has been received we can continue with depositing this paper to Spiral.
>Please note that the accepted manuscript needs to have been uploaded in arXiv prior to the date of first publication in order for the output to be compliant.
>If the accepted manuscript has been uploaded to another University repository please let us know.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting a link to your publication. In order for the open access team to check whether your output is compliant with the next Research Excellence Framework (REF) we need to determine that the version linked to in the pre-print server is the accepted version of this paper. As such, could you please supply a statement confirming this, as per below:

>I, the author of [TITLE, DOI/CITATION], can confirm that the version of the paper currently held in [THE NAME OF PRE-PRINT SERVER (e.g. arXiv or bioRxiv)] and [NUMBER OF PRE-PRINT VERSION (if any)], version 1/2/3/4 etc., is the accepted manuscript version of this paper, which was submitted to [THE NAME OF PRE-PRINT SERVER] on [DEPOSIT DATE], prior to its first publication on [PUBLICATION DATE].

>We require this statement to be able to demonstrate your paper’s compliance with the next REF (scheduled for 2027) open access policy. Once this statement has been received we can continue with depositing this paper to Spiral.
>Please note that the accepted manuscript needs to have been uploaded in arXiv prior to the date of first publication in order for the output to be compliant.
>If the accepted manuscript has been uploaded to another University repository please let us know.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk

column7: >This journal is not compliant with the next Research Excellence Framework (REF) which is scheduled for 2027 but there is an exception for publishers that do not permit deposits in institutional repositories, as long as it is the 'most appropriate publication'. However, the Heads of Departments will decide which journals will be eligible for exception where REF eligibility is concerned. In the meantime, the open access team are making a note of all outputs that are potentially eligible for exception.
>If you have any questions on this please contact the REF contact for your department: <span style=""background-color: #ffff00

column9: >COPY LINK FROM SHERPA/ROMEO. However, the pubisher only allows deposit in PubMed Central. If you already have the link to PMC you can use this instead by adding the link to the OA location field in Symplectic and removing the file. As PMC is a compliant repository for the REF you can deposit the link to make this output compliant.

column7: >If you do not have a link, this journal is not compliant with the next Research Excellence Framework (REF) which is scheduled for 2027. An exception permits publishers that do not permit deposits in institutional repositories, as long as it is the 'most appropriate publication'. However, the Heads of Departments will decide which journals will be eligible for exception where REF eligibility is concerned. In the meantime, the open access team are making a note of all outputs that are potentially eligible for exception.
>If you have any questions on this please contact the REF contact for your department: <span style=""background-color: #ffff00

>3. Proof of permission from the copyright holder to add this paper to Spiral

column1: Academic Social Networking site (ResearchGate),"<!-- [if gte mso 9]><xml>

column7: >Thank you for providing a web link to your paper. However, we can generally only approve web links to manuscripts deposited in other repositories as an alternative to the manuscript being uploaded. In this case, the URL is from an Academic Social Networking Site (such as ResearchGate). As these sites are not recognised as an institutional or subject open access repository, they are not a compliant Open Access location that meets the open access requirements of Research Excellence Framework (REF), your funder(s) (if any), and the College (Please see our guide on how to use academic social network sites).

>If you have a co-author and they have already deposited it in another repository you can provide a URL link to it. If not, please can you return to the record in Symplectic and upload copy of your accepted manuscript.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk

column7: >Thank you for submitting your thesis. Please note that Imperial theses are not submitted through Symplectic but submitted directly to Spiral. All Imperial theses are checked by the Assessment Records team (please see: 'Theses for Imperial College Research Degrees' on submitting your thesis).

>After the examination is complete and any required minor revisions have been approved, you should make sure that the final copy of your thesis is submitted to Registry via Spiral as soon as possible. The College will not issue the result of the examination to successful candidates until it has received the final submission and the examiners have confirmed that any amendments to the thesis required by them have been made (please see introductory paragraph of this leaflet).


-->

>Your final thesis must be submitted online by uploading to Spiral (the College’s digital repository). Your final thesis must be in PDF/A format and all fonts used must be embedded within the PDF file. Please do not include your signature in the thesis.


-->

>For further information on preparing your final thesis for submission to Spiral and creating your PDF file, please refer to the Library’s Open Access webpages and FAQs.


-->

>Please note that your submission will be checked by Research Degrees before being released to the Spiral team in the Library, and your thesis will only be made publicly available upon expiry of any agreed embargo. Bound copies of the final thesis, or electronic copies in any other format are no longer required. You do not need to submit any additional forms at this stage, providing you have already submitted your Thesis Declaration Form.


-->

>CLICK HERE to upload and submit your final thesis. Your final thesis must be in PDF/A format and all fonts used must be embedded within the PDF file. Please note that theses submitted in any other fomat will not be accepted and may result in the award of the degree being delayed.
>For futher queries please contact the Assessment Records team at assessment.records@imperial.ac.uk.

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper for inclusion on Spiral. I notice that the file provided has been heavily edited and contains corrections, review comments and suchlike.

>Do you have a cleaner version of this accepted manuscript available? If you do, please replace the file currently deposited with this cleaner version, which we can then proceed to publish in Spiral. If you do not have an alternative version, and are happy for this version to be published in Spiral as-is, please confirm, and I will proceed to complete the deposit in Spiral.

>Thank you for submitting your thesis. Imperial theses are not submitted through Symplectic but submitted directly to Spiral. All Imperial theses are checked by Research Degrees, so please see our procedures https://www.imperial.ac.uk/media/imperial-college/administration-and-support-services/registry/academic-governance/public/academic-policy/research-degree-examinations/Submission-Checklist-for-Imperial-College-Degrees.pdf

>15. Final Thesis Submission
After the examination is complete and any required minor revisions have
been approved, you should make sure that the final copy of your thesis is
submitted to Registry via Spiral as soon as possible. The College will not
issue the result of the examination to successful candidates until it has
received the final submission and the examiners have confirmed that any
amendments to the thesis required by them have been made (please see
introductory paragraph of this leaflet).
Your final thesis must be submitted online by uploading to Spiral (the
College&rsquo
column8:
s digital repository). Your final thesis must be in PDF/A format and
all fonts used must be embedded within the PDF file. Please do not
include your signature in the thesis.
For further information on preparing your final thesis for submission to
Spiral and creating your PDF file, please refer to the Library&rsquo
column9:
s Open
Access webpages and FAQs.
Please note that your submission will be checked by Research Degrees
before being released to the Spiral team in the library, and your thesis will
only be made publicly available upon expiry of any agreed embargo.
Bound copies of the final thesis, or electronic copies in any other format
are no longer required. You do not need to submit any additional forms at
this stage, providing you have already submitted your Thesis Declaration
Form.
CLICK HERE https://spiral.imperial.ac.uk/ldap-login
column10:
TO UPLOAD AND SUBMIT YOUR FINAL THESIS
Theses submitted in any other format will not be accepted and may
result in the award of the degree being delayed.

column7: >email the Research Degrees team at research.degree@imperial.ac.uk for further information.

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your thesis. Unfortunately I am unable to approve the deposit as we do not accept theses and dissertations that have not been awarded by Imperial College London. May I suggest that you contact the institution’s library from where the item was examined and request to deposit in their institutional repository. Most research institutions have an open access repository and a full list is available via the Registry of Open Access Repositories: http://roar.eprints.org/

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper. Unfortunately, I was unable to approve your submission because you have not specified a submission date in Symplectic record. As your paper acknowledges a UKRI fund, we require this information to see whether you are within the scope of the UKRI new open access policy.
>Can you please confirm that you submitted your work to the publisher?
>If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us via openaccess@imperial.ac.uk.

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper. You seem to acknowledge a UKRI grant in your paper. According to the UKRI new open access policy, all UKRI funded researchers are asked to include the following licensing text to their submitted version. We are unable to identify this text in your accepted manuscript. Can you please confirm if you added the licensing text to your submitted version? We require this information to ensure the compliance of your paper with the new policy.
>""‘For the purpose of open access, the author has applied a ‘Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) licence to any Author Accepted Manuscript (AAM) version arising’""
>We would advice you to add the rights assertion statement to any future of your submission.
>If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us via openaccess@imperial.ac.uk.

column13: href=""https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/8c436bb8-c91e-4be8-a21a-69c4207a4b20 "" target=""_blank"">

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting your paper. I have noticed that you deposited this research output as a journal article. However, external data sources in the record indicate that this output is a working paper (preprint). Also, I was unable to identify any journal article published for this title. Can you please clarify if this work has been accepted for publication or it is a pre-print only?

>If it is accepted, can you please provide us with the name of the journal and the acceptance date? I will amend the record by adding the information we need and then process the submission. If it has not been accepted, I will change the record's type to working paper and process it accordingly. Please note that no action is required from you apart from confirming the acceptance status by responding to this email.
>If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us via

>Thank you for submitting your paper. I have noticed that you deposited this research output as a conference paper. However, external datasources in the record indicate that this output is just a working paper (preprint). Also, I was unable to identify any conference proceeding published for this title. Can you please clarify if this work has been accepted for publication or it is a pre-print only?

>If it is accepted, can you please provide us the title, location, and dates of the conference with the acceptance date? I will amend the record by adding the information we need and then process the submission. If it has not been accepted, I will change the record's type to working paper and process it accordingly. Please note that no action is required from you apart from confirming the acceptance status by responding to this email.
>If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us via

column8: s layout etc.) By doing so you will be compliant with the next Research Excellence Framework (REF) which is scheduled for 2027 but also with the College open access policy.

column7: >Please see the self-archiving policy of BMJ
>To find the correct version of your research output, please follow the steps below:
>1. Find your journal submission page. Log in.
>2. Click on the ""author"" button located on the top left side of the page. This will redirect you to the author dashboard.
>3. Click on ""Manuscripts with Decisions"" in the sidebar.
>4. Click ‘View Submission’ under the title of the manuscript you want. A blinded PDF of your article will download.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk

column7: >Thank you for depositing your work. Do you have permission from the publisher to deposit your work in Spiral? You can only deposit the accepted manuscript after obtaining permission from ASME. Please see their self archiving policy.

>If you do not have permission, please send your request to Journal_repository@asme.org. Please include the following informaion in your request: ASME paper number, title, DOI, URL of paper, and description and link of funder, governmental, or institutional repository.
> If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk.

column2: >
column4: sysparm_category=d9f47293db11d70006ceb14ffe9619de"" target=""_blank"">

column7: >Thank you for submitting this master's thesis which you supervised. Unfortunately, I am unable to approve the deposit as Master's dissertations are managed by departments. Administrators in each department are responsible for collating all dissertations as PDF files and for creating their bibliographic data. ICT then upload the files and data to Spiral. For a full list of departments with MScs and dissertations in Spiral, see our pages.

>If your department would like to do this, please note: your departmental administrators will be responsible for the data entry you must use the Masters dissertations template (Excel) for data entry and you must follow the data entry and upload guidelines, see Guidelines for uploading Master's dissertations to Spiral (pdf). Also, you must upload the files and completed spreadsheet to OneDrive, as per the upload guidelines.
>If you encounter any problems please reply to this message, or contact the open access team at openaccess@imperial.ac.uk
